TopicTitle: [0.25] RasterPropMonitor - putting the A in your IVA (v0.18.3) [8 Oct]

Articles.Content:
I've just reinstalled Firespitter and it did not solve the problem.

Anything else outdated? Pre-2.1.1 MechJeb, old KAS, old Exsurgent Engineering, old Procedural Fairings, anything? Something causes an error that shuts down modules execution before RPM ever gets to draw on the screen, the log does not say exactly what.

I don't quite get what you mean by 'default buttons' in this sentence.

I meant the added clickable coloured buttons to activate lights, brakes, gear, SAS, RCS,...

I meant the added clickable coloured buttons to activate lights, brakes, gear, SAS, RCS,...

That isn't what you normally call "default".

Regardless, I will make labels for them, eventually, but it turned out to be too impractical without introducing more new props.

Whenever I try to run this mod, my game stops loading at Squad/spaces/GenericSpace1/internal/GenericSpace1. It loads if I delete the file, but then the interfce starts to display incorrectly. Is there any way to fix this?
Okay, the cupola is pretty much broken, the screens and everything else won't show up.

Whenever I try to run this mod, my game stops loading at Squad/spaces/GenericSpace1/internal/GenericSpace1. It loads if I delete the file, but then the interfce starts to display incorrectly. Is there any way to fix this?

There probably is if you show me your KSP_Data/output_log.txt when it is not deleted.

Okay, the cupola is pretty much broken, the screens and everything else won't show up.

Okay. "pretty much broken" is not a description of symptoms. "everything else" is not a description of what you expect to see that you are not seeing.

--- Something loose in cockpit.

--- Something tightened in cockpit.

Jeez. Ask good questions and I shall answer every one. Ask bad questions and I'll practice sarcasm on you, I'm sorely tempted.

--- Something loose in cockpit.

--- Something tightened in cockpit.

Also:

--- Aircraft Rocket handles funny.

--- Aircraft Rocket warned to straighten up, fly right, and be serious.

Sorry for Off-Topic, but I couldn't resist.

Sorry for Off-Topic, but I couldn't resist.

It's ok, "Cannot reproduce the problem on the ground" sounds completely natural around here anyway.

Anything else outdated? Pre-2.1.1 MechJeb, old KAS, old Exsurgent Engineering, old Procedural Fairings, anything? Something causes an error that shuts down modules execution before RPM ever gets to draw on the screen, the log does not say exactly what.

I updated a few mods and it works now. Thanks for your help.

If you do decide to make a replacement IVA for the Mk1-2 pod, I'd be thrilled if the seats were raised to the point where the pilots can actually see straight forward out the front windows. See FASA Gemini for a great example of how good the visibility through tiny windows can be.
I'm having trouble using the TMA-1 orbital orb with the rpm's, when I put it on the launchpad there are no crew portraits and I can't use both spacecraft and IVA

I'm having trouble using the TMA-1 orbital orb with the rpm's, when I put it on the launchpad there are no crew portraits and I can't use both spacecraft and IVA

I have also ran into this problem then , KSP shortly crashed after that.

I love this mod!

one thing though, and I'm not sure if this was already adressed, but here we go.

The AoA ladder in the "Aviation" Attitide indicator, (the thing that looks like the HUD from military aircraft/the G1000 flight avionics system) is upside down. As in the ladder should go the other way in the vertical orientation. The roll is correct, but the pitch is inverted for some reason... the only other mod I'm using is the Kerbal Beautification Project (you know, the one that gives you clouds and cities) but I can't see how that would interefere.

Just bringing that to your attention.

Great mod! Maaaaaybe sound effects? like the T-CAS system? or *****in' betty? just a thought.

I'm having trouble using the TMA-1 orbital orb with the rpm's, when I put it on the launchpad there are no crew portraits and I can't use both spacecraft and IVA
I have also ran into this problem then , KSP shortly crashed after that.

Oops. Fixed. Please re-download.

The AoA ladder in the "Aviation" Attitide indicator, (the thing that looks like the HUD from military aircraft/the G1000 flight avionics system) is upside down.

Yes, I noticed that one too late. Fixed in the dev version.

Great mod! Maaaaaybe sound effects? like the T-CAS system? or *****in' betty? just a thought.

ALCOR has them already. I simply don't have the time to make use of every single feature I have coded, there's just too many.

I found this a few days ago and it's now my all time favorite KSP mod. The documentation is also awesome.

I have a request for variables, if it's possible. The protractor variables only work for celestial bodies, but Kerbal Engineer will do them for vessels as well. It's the only thing that keeps me from doing pure IVA launch/orbit/rendezvous missions, because I have to turn on Kerbal Engineer for a minute to get the phase angle right. I was able to get a new screen added and started adding in those variables, but then I realized they were only for celestial bodies. Or maybe I missed something?

Just a suggestion, if it's not too difficult. I am still having a blast with this excellent mod. Thanks!

*grumble grumble* Ignore this post!

Edited January 12, 2014 by Termaul

At first the screens change to what is displayed on the screens im currently looking at then when I switch IVA's to a another kerbal the screens flip again to grey then black then random. Where about can I get the debug log and I shall post it. thx

Open the debug menu, select the GameDatabase tab, and locate the pod config for the pod you're flying. Doublecheck that it contains 'MODULE{name=RasterPropMonitorComputer' rather than 'MODULE{name=JSIInternalPersistence'. If it does not, you have an installation problem.

If it does, I want to see your KSP_Data/output_log.txt

Open the debug menu, select the GameDatabase tab, and locate the pod config for the pod you're flying. Doublecheck that it contains 'MODULE{name=RasterPropMonitorComputer' rather than 'MODULE{name=JSIInternalPersistence'. If it does not, you have an installation problem.

If it does, I want to see your KSP_Data/output_log.txt
